p: What a lovely long letter you wrote me for my birthday! I'll lay it away so that I can read it every once in a while.
How are you getting on with your sewing? Is the thimble beeping much? How is Shirley's head feeling now?
We need some houses built in our front room. When do you think you could build them for us?
Dr. George says that Miss Muffet is not a lady. He says she is just a tom boy. Miss Muffet says why are cats anyway? But they don't fight.
Nanny says you are a lady, and so does your loving
